relationships.description: Harry knows about Ron yet. This relationship is described in the text as 'it did not seem that people knew about Ron yet'.
Dumbledore and Snape argued with each other. This relationship is described in the text as 'So Dumbledore had argued with Snape'.

Harry trusted Dumbledore completely. However, this relationship is not bidirectional because Harry did not trust Snape completely. This relationship is described in the text as 'in spite of his insistence that he trusted Snape completely'.

Snape investigated the Slytherins. However, this relationship is not bidirectional because Snape did not investigate them hard enough. This relationship is described in the text as 'he had lost his temper with him ... he did not think that Snape had tried hard enough to investigate the Slytherins'.
Snape investigated Malfoy. This relationship is described in the text as 'or, perhaps, to investigate a single Slytherin: Malfoy?'.
